alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Thomas (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 10:30AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Jefferson, southeastern Thomas and southwestern Brooks Counties through 1115 AM EDT... At 1030 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Boston, or 11 miles northeast of Monticello, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Dills, Everett, Grooverville, Ashville and Empress. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
